intro: Chaetospora flexuosa, commonly known as the flexible spikemoss, is a member of the family Selaginellaceae and is characterized by its creeping, branching stems covered in small, scale-like leaves. It is a vascular plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant produces microspores and megaspores on separate structures, contributing to its reproductive strategy. Its morphology includes distinctive, spirally arranged leaves and specialized sporophylls that bear the spores. Chaetospora flexuosa plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
